marketNews.title: RI Setop Impor Beras, Stok Tertinggi dalam 57 Tahun
marketNews.content: Coordinator of Food Affairs Minister Zulkifli Hasan said on Thursday (8 May) that the government will no longer import rice in 2025, as domestic production and stock have risen sharply. Indonesia produced 8.61 million tonnes of rice in the first quarter of 2025, a 53 percent year-on-year increase. Perum Bulog reported that the government’s rice reserve stock at Bulog warehouses reached 3.6 million tonnes at the beginning of May 2025, the highest level in the past 57 years. In a press conference on Friday (2 May), BPS projected that total rice production for the first half of 2025 could reach 18.76 million tonnes, an 11.2 percent year-on-year increase, supported by favorable weather and a significant expansion of harvested area to 6.22 million hectares, up 11.9 percent year-on-year. In addition, the US Department of Agriculture’s report in April 2025 estimated that Indonesia’s rice production for the 2024/2025 cropping season would rise 4.8 percent year-on-year to 34.6 million tonnes, the highest projected volume in Southeast Asia. The government targets national rice production at 32.8 million tonnes for 2025. The increase reflects a post-El Niño recovery in 2023, which had pushed domestic rice prices up about 20 percent year-on-year in March 2024. The abundant supply also led to a 1-2 percent year-on-year decline in rice prices in April 2025, continuing a 4-9 percent decline in March 2025. Key Takeaway: The rise in domestic production and stock can limit the risk of a rice price surge like that seen in early 2024. Rice prices have been relatively stable since the second half of 2024. If rice management remains effective, production growth can continue without a sharp price drop, which would benefit consumer purchasing power and farmer income. Moreover, the elimination of rice imports can reduce Indonesia’s import bill. Over the ten months of 2024, BPS recorded that Indonesia imported 3.48 million tonnes of rice worth USD 2.2 billion (approximately IDR 34.2 trillion).

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
1. US President Donald Trump and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Thursday (8 May) agreed on a trade framework between the two countries, marking the first trade agreement the US has signed with a partner since Trump announced reciprocal tariffs in April 2025. Trump praised the deal as a "breakthrough" that could open further agreements to expand market access for US goods. Under the framework, the UK will accelerate customs clearance for US goods and reduce barriers on agricultural, chemical, energy and industrial exports. The UK government said the US will cut automotive import tariffs to 10 percent and metal import tariffs to zero. Final details will be negotiated over the coming weeks.
2. Reuters reported that OPEC oil production in April 2025 fell to 26.6 million barrels per day, 30,000 barrels per day lower than March 2025, despite OPEC+ planning to raise output in April. The decline was mainly due to reduced output from Venezuela, where exports contracted after the cancellation of a cargo to Chevron (NYSE: CVX) amid US actions to disrupt Venezuelan oil exports.
3. The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) recorded that domestic motorcycle sales in April 2025 fell to 406,691 units (-3 percent year-on-year, -25 percent month-on-month). Cumulative sales for the first four months of 2025 reached about 2.1 million units (-3 percent year-on-year), representing 31-33 percent of the 2025 target of 6.4-6.7 million units.
4. Bank Indonesia reported that the Indonesian Consumer Confidence Index rose to 121.7 in April 2025 (vs. 121.1 in March 2025), the first increase in four months. The rise was driven by a +3.1-point increase in the current economic conditions index, while the consumer expectations index fell by 1.9 points due to lower expectations for job availability (-2.4 points) and business activity (-3.7 points).
5. Budihardjo Iduansjah, Chairman of the Indonesian Retailers and Shopping Center Tenants Association (Hippindo), said the association sees a potential reduction in retail employment due to store rationalisation. Although no official data from members are available, Hippindo warns that the trend of store closures should be monitored. He explained that the retail sector overall is underperforming, highlighted by weak sales during the 2025 Lebaran period compared with previous years.
6. Djoko Widajatno, member of the Advisory Council of the Indonesian Nickel Mining Association, said the Philippines' plan to ban nickel ore exports starting June 2025 could significantly affect Indonesian nickel smelters. Indonesia imported about 10 million tonnes of nickel ore from the Philippines in 2024, mainly for the Morowali and Weda Bay smelters. The ban could tighten global nickel ore supply and push prices up, offering short-term benefits to Indonesian nickel producers but raising operational costs for smelters.
7. Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said on Thursday (8 May) that the government will stop importing oil from Singapore within six months, replacing it with imports from Middle Eastern countries and the United States. The decision is based on price parity with Middle Eastern oil and geopolitical considerations. Kontan reported that 54-59 percent of Indonesia’s oil imports currently come from Singapore.
8. Bitcoin again broke the US$100,000 level on Thursday (8 May), the first time since February 2025, though still below the all-time high of around US$109,000 set in January 2025. The rise occurred after the US-UK trade agreement was announced, raising optimism about de-escalation of trade tensions.
9. Sheila Aryyani Hanusanti, General Manager of Marketing at Milk Cisarua Mountain Dairy (CMRY), said the company launched a new dessert product called "Cimory Eat Milk" nationwide on 1 May 2025. The product is packaged in pouches and is offered in three flavours, targeting Indonesian consumers who like to have a sweet snack after a heavy meal.
10. Robert Francis Prevost was elected as the 267th Pope. Prevost, born in the United States and holding Peruvian citizenship, is the first Pope born in the United States and the second from South America. He chose the papal name Leo XIV.

tickerNews.title: BUMI: Impact of Quasi-Reorganization to Appear in 2Q25 Financial Report
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources clarified to the IDX that the impact of the planned quasi-reorganization will be reflected in the 2Q25 financial statements, provided the plan is approved at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders on 2 June 2025. BUMI stated that the quasi-reorganization would allow the company to distribute dividends. The plan had been delayed in 2024 due to a disagreement between the company and OJK over the definition of current-year profit. The company used the profit attributable to the parent entity as the basis for meeting the quasi-reorganization requirements, while OJK required the calculation to be based on total current-year profit.

tickerNews.title: RALS: Approval of 2024 Dividend Distribution
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Ramayana Lestari Sentosa approved a dividend distribution for fiscal year 2024 amounting to IDR 356 billion, or IDR 60 per share, representing a 113.3 percent dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 13.1 percent as of Friday (9 May). The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiations on 21 May 2025, with payment scheduled for 13 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: PTBA: Potential Revocation of Mining Licences if DME Project Not Implemented
tickerNews.content: Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia affirmed that the ministry will revoke part of the mining licence area of PT Bukit Asam (PTBA) if the company does not implement the coal-to-dimethyl ether (DME) project. Earlier, PTBA President Director Arsal Ismail said in April 2025 that the company would support the government’s downstream coal initiatives, including the coal-to-DME project and substitute natural gas (SNG). However, Arsal noted that PTBA would study the DME project carefully because its former partner, Air Products & Chemicals Inc., withdrew from the project in 2023.

tickerNews.title: PNLF: Panin Financial Announces Sharia Unit Split
tickerNews.content: Panin Financial announced that its subsidiary, PT Panin Dai-ichi Life, plans to separate its sharia business by establishing a new sharia insurance company named PT Panin Dai-ichi Life Sharia.

tickerNews.title: PANR: Dividend Distribution and Additional Share Purchase in PDES
tickerNews.content: Panorama Sentrawisata will distribute a dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately IDR 83.3 billion, or IDR 60 per share, indicating a dividend yield of 7.1 percent as of Friday (9 May). The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiations on 9 May 2025, with payment on 4 June 2025. In a separate transaction, PANR increased its ownership in Destinasi Tirta Nusantara (PDES) by 1.5 million shares at IDR 330 per share on 6 May 2025, raising its stake from 63.8 percent to 64.01 percent.

tickerNews.title: SMAR: Plan to Add Biogas Business
tickerNews.content: Sinar Mas Agro Resources and Technology plans to add a biogas business. The biogas plant will capture methane generated from palm oil mill effluent (POME) and convert it into compressed biogas (Bio-CNG). The plan will be discussed at the shareholders’ meeting on 16 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: FAPA: Sale of Shares by Prinsep Management Limited
tickerNews.content: Prinsep Management Limited, the controlling shareholder of FAP Agri, sold approximately 14.2 million FAPA shares at IDR 5,300 per share on 24 April 2025. The total transaction value was IDR 75.1 billion. After the transaction, Prinsep Management Limited’s ownership decreased from 76.14 percent to 75.74 percent.

tickerNews.title: SMSM: Directors Sumarni and Roni Kunto Purchase Shares
tickerNews.content: Two directors of Selamat Sempurna, Sumarni and Roni Kunto, each bought shares of SMSM. Sumarni purchased 750,000 shares at an average price of IDR 1,610 per share on 7 May 2025, valued at approximately IDR 1.21 billion. Roni Kunto bought 167,800 shares at the same average price on the same day, valued at about IDR 271 million. After the purchases, Sumarni’s ownership increased from 0.05 percent to 0.06 percent, while Roni Kunto’s ownership rose from 0.011 percent to 0.014 percent.

tickerNews.title: BTEK: Share Purchase by PT Asabri
tickerNews.content: PT Asabri, a shareholder of Bumi Teknokultura Unggul (BTEK), bought 743 million BTEK shares. The transaction amount was not disclosed. After the purchase, PT Asabri’s ownership increased from 8.11 percent to 9.71 percent.

tickerNews.title: CMRY: Launch of New Dessert Product "Cimory Eat Milk"
tickerNews.content: Sheila Aryyani Hanusanti, General Manager of Marketing at Milk Cisarua Mountain Dairy (CMRY), announced that the company launched a new dessert product called "Cimory Eat Milk" nationwide on 1 May 2025. The product is packaged in a pouch, offered in three flavours, and targets Indonesian consumers who like to have a sweet snack after a heavy meal.
